member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.PS_INSIDEFRAME
member.summary: The pen is solid. When this pen is used in any GDI drawing function that takes a bounding rectangle, the dimensions of the figure are shrunk so that it fits entirely in the bounding rectangle, taking into account the width of the pen. This applies only to geometric pens.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.PS_ALTERNATE
member.summary: Windows NT/2000/XP: The pen sets every other pixel. (This style is applicable only for cosmetic pens.)

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.SRCCOPY

member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.SRCAND
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.SRCINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.summary: Combines the inverted colors of the destination rectangle with the colors of the source rectangle by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.summary: Copies the inverted source rectangle to the destination.

member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator and then inverts the resultant color.

member.summary: Merges the colors of the source rectangle with the specified pattern by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.summary: Merges the colors of the inverted source rectangle with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.PATCOPY
member.summary: Copies the specified pattern into the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.PATPAINT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the pattern with the colors of the inverted source rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.PATINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the specified pattern with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.DSTINVERT
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.BLACKNESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinGdi.WHITENESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. (This color is white for the default physical palette.)

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS
member.summary: Contains information that an application can use while processing the WM_NCCALCSIZE message to calculate the size, position, and valid contents of the client area of a window.
member.remarks: If the window is a child window, the coordinates are relative to the client area of the parent window. If the window is a top-level window, the coordinates are relative to the screen origin.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectProposed
member.summary: Contains the new coordinates of a window that has been moved or resized, that is, it is the proposed new window coordinates.

member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window before it was moved or resized.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectClientBeforeMove
member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window's client area before the window was moved or resized.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.lppos
member.summary: Pointer to a WINDOWPOS structure that contains the size and position values specified in the operation that moved or resized the window.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.CreatePen(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a logical pen that has the specified style, width, and color. The pen can subsequently be selected into a device context and used to draw lines and curves.
member.param: Specifies the pen style.

Specifies the width of the pen, in logical units. If nWidth is zero, the pen is a single pixel wide, regardless of the current transformation. CreatePen returns a pen with the specified width bit with the PS_SOLID style if you specify a width greater than one for the following styles: PS_DASH, PS_DOT, PS_DASHDOT, PS_DASHDOTDOT.
Specifies a color reference for the pen color.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle that identifies a logical pen. If the function fails, the return value is IntPtr.Zero. Windows NT/2000/XP: To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.ExtCreatePen(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Genetibase.WinApi.LOGBRUSH@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Creates a logical cosmetic or geometric pen that has the specified style, width, and brush attributes.
member.param: Specifies a combination of type, style, end cap, and join attributes. The values from each category are combined by using the bitwise OR operator (|).
Specifies the width of the pen. If the dwPenStyle parameter is PS_GEOMETRIC, the width is given in logical units. If dwPenStyle is PS_COSMETIC, the width must be set to 1.

Pointer to a LOGBRUSH structure. If dwPenStyle is PS_COSMETIC, the lbColor member specifies the color of the pen and the lbStyle member must be set to BS_SOLID. If dwPenStyle is PS_GEOMETRIC, all members must be used to specify the brush attributes of the pen.
Specifies the length, in DWORD units, of the lpStyle array. This value must be zero if dwPenStyle is not PS_USERSTYLE.

Pointer to an array. The first value specifies the length of the first dash in a user-defined style, the second value specifies the length of the first space, and so on. This pointer must be null if dwPenStyle is not PS_USERSTYLE.

Specifies the width of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
Specifies the height of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.SelectObject(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Selects an object into the specified device context. The new object replaces the previous object of the same type.
member.param: Identifies the device context.
Identifies the object to be selected.
member.returns: If the selected object is not a region and the function succeeds, the return value is the handle of the object being replaced. If the selected object is a region and the function succeeds, the return value is one of the following values: SIMPLEREGION (region consists of a single rectangle), COMPLEXREGION (region consists of more than one rectangle), NULLREGION (region is empty). If an error occurs and the selected object is not a region, the return value is IntPtr.Zero. Otherwise, it is GDI_ERROR.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.SetBkColor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current background color to the specified color value, or to the nearest physical color if the device cannot represent the specified color value.
member.param: Identifies the device context.
Specifies the new background color.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies the previous background color as a COLORREF value. If the function fails, the return value is CLR_INVALID.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.SetBkMode(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the background mix mode of the specified device context. The background mix mode is used with text, hatched brushes, and pen styles that are not solid lines.
member.param: Handle to the device context.

Specifies the background mode. This parameter can be one of the following values. OPAQUE: Background is filled with the current background color before the text, hatched brush, or pen is drawn. -or- TRANSPARENT: Background remains untouched.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies the previous background mode; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.Gdi32.SetROP2(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current foreground mix mode. GDI uses the foreground mix mode to combine pens and interiors of filled objects with the colors already on the screen. The foreground mix mode defines how colors from the brush or pen and the colors in the existing image are to be combined.
member.param: Identifies the device context.
Specifies the new mix mode.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies the previous mix mode, otherwise the return value is zero.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION
member.summary: Controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION.BlendOp
member.summary: Specifies the source blend operation. Currently, the only source and destination blend operation that has been defined is AC_SRC_OVER.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION.BlendFlags
member.summary: Must be zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION.SourceConstantAlpha
member.summary: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap. The SourceConstantAlpha value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap. If you set SourceConstantAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent. Set the SourceConstantAlpha value to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION.AlphaFormat
member.summary: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser
member.summary: Defines constants declared in WinUser.h.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.BS_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: Creates an owner-drawn button. The owner window receives a WM_MEASUREITEM message when the button is created and a WM_DRAWITEM message when a visual aspect of the button has changed. Do not combine the BS_OWNERDRAW style with any other button styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_VREDRAW
member.summary: The CS_VREDRAW style causes a window to be completely redrawn whenever its vertical size (height) changes.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_HREDRAW
member.summary: The CS_HREDRAW style causes a window to be completely redrawn whenever its horizontal size (width) changes.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_DBLCLKS
member.summary: The CS_DBLCLKS style causes Windows to detect a double-click (the user clicking the left mouse button twice in quick succession) for an application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_OWNDC
member.summary: Allocates a unique device context for each window in the class.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_CLASSDC
member.summary: Allocates one device context to be shared by all windows in the class. Because window classes are process specific, it is possible for multiple threads of an application to create a window of the same class. It is also possible for the threads to attempt to use the device context simultaneously. When this happens, the system allows only one thread to successfully finish its drawing operation.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_PARENTDC
member.summary: Sets the clipping rectangle of the child window to that of the parent window so that the child can draw on the parent. A window with the CS_PARENTDC style bit receives a regular device context from the system's cache of device contexts. It does not give the child the parent's device context or device context settings. Specifying CS_PARENTDC enhances an application's performance.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_NOCLOSE
member.summary: A window that belongs to a class with the CS_NOCLOSE style does not have the Close command in its System menu.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_SAVEBITS
member.summary: Menus, dialog boxes, and combo list boxes have the CS_SAVEBITS style. When you use this style for a window, Windows saves a bitmap copy of the screen image that the window obscures.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_BYTEALIGNCLIENT
member.summary: Aligns the window's client area on a byte boundary (in the x direction). This style affects the width of the window and its horizontal placement on the display.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_BYTEALIGNWINDOW
member.summary: Aligns the window on a byte boundary (in the x direction). This style affects the width of the window and its horizontal placement on the display.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_GLOBALCLASS
member.summary: Specifies that the window class is an application global class.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_IME
member.summary: The UI class should be registered with CS_IME specified in the style field so every application can use it through the IME class.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CS_DROPSHADOW
member.summary: Enables the drop shadow effect on a window. The effect is turned on and off through SPI_SETDROPSHADOW. Typically, this is enabled for small, short-lived windows such as menus to emphasize their Z order relationship to other windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CWP_ALL
member.summary: Does not skip any child windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CWP_SKIPINVISIBLE
member.summary: Skips invisible child windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CWP_SKIPDISABLED
member.summary: Skips disabled child windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.CWP_SKIPTRANSPARENT
member.summary: Skips transparent child windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETSEL
member.summary: Retrieves the starting and ending character positions of the current selection in an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETSEL
member.summary: Selects a range of characters in an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETRECT
member.summary: Retrieves the formatting rectangle of an edit control. The formatting rectangle is the limiting rectangle into which the control draws the text. The limiting rectangle is independent of the size of the edit-control window. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETRECT
member.summary: Sets the formatting rectangle of a multiline edit control. The formatting rectangle is the limiting rectangle into which the control draws the text. The limiting rectangle is independent of the size of the edit control window. This message is processed only by multiline edit controls. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETRECTNP
member.summary: Sets the formatting rectangle of a multiline edit control. The EM_SETRECTNP message is identical to the EM_SETRECT message, except that EM_SETRECTNP does not redraw the edit control window. The formatting rectangle is the limiting rectangle into which the control draws the text. The limiting rectangle is independent of the size of the edit control window. This message is processed only by multiline edit controls. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls the text vertically in a multiline edit control. This message is equivalent to sending a WM_VSCROLL message to the edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_LINESCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls the text in a multiline edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SCROLLCARET
member.summary: Scrolls the caret into view in an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETMODIFY
member.summary: Retrieves the state of an edit control's modification flag. The flag indicates whether the contents of the edit control have been modified. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETMODIFY
member.summary: Sets or clears the modification flag for an edit control. The modification flag indicates whether the text within the edit control has been modified. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETLINECOUNT
member.summary: Retrieves the number of lines in a multiline edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_LINEINDEX
member.summary: Retrieves the character index of the first character of a specified line in a multiline edit control. A character index is the zero-based index of the character from the beginning of the edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETHANDLE
member.summary: Sets the handle of the memory that will be used by a multiline edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETHANDLE
member.summary: Retrieves a handle of the memory currently allocated for a multiline edit control's text.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETTHUMB
member.summary: Retrieves the position of the scroll box (thumb) in the vertical scroll bar of a multiline edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_LINELENGTH
member.summary: Retrieves the length, in characters, of a line in an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_REPLACESEL
member.summary: Replaces the current selection in an edit control with the specified text. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETLINE
member.summary: Copies a line of text from an edit control and places it in a specified buffer. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_LIMITTEXT
member.summary: Sets the text limit of an edit control. The text limit is the maximum amount of text, in TCHARs, that the user can type into the edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_CANUNDO
member.summary: Determines whether there are any actions in an edit control's undo queue. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_UNDO
member.summary: Undoes the last edit control operation in the control's undo queue. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_FMTLINES
member.summary: Sets a flag that determines whether a multiline edit control includes soft line-break characters. A soft line break consists of two carriage returns and a line feed and is inserted at the end of a line that is broken because of wordwrapping.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_LINEFROMCHAR
member.summary: Retrieves the index of the line that contains the specified character index in a multiline edit control. A character index is the zero-based index of the character from the beginning of the edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETTABSTOPS
member.summary: Sets the tab stops in a multiline edit control. When text is copied to the control, any tab character in the text causes space to be generated up to the next tab stop.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETPASSWORDCHAR
member.summary: Sets or removes the password character for an edit control. When a password character is set, that character is displayed in place of the characters typed by the user. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_EMPTYUNDOBUFFER
member.summary: Resets the undo flag of an edit control. The undo flag is set whenever an operation within the edit control can be undone. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETFIRSTVISIBLELINE
member.summary: Retrieves the zero-based index of the uppermost visible line in a multiline edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETREADONLY
member.summary: Sets or removes the read-only style (ES_READONLY) of an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETWORDBREAKPROC
member.summary: Replaces an edit control's default Wordwrap function with an application-defined Wordwrap function. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETWORDBREAKPROC
member.summary: Retrieves the address of the current Wordwrap function. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETPASSWORDCHAR
member.summary: Retrieves the password character that an edit control displays when the user enters text. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETMARGINS
member.summary: Sets the widths of the left and right margins for an edit control. The message redraws the control to reflect the new margins. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETMARGINS
member.summary: Retrieves the widths of the left and right margins for an edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETLIMITTEXT
member.summary: sets the text limit of an edit control. The text limit is the maximum amount of text, in TCHARs, that the user can type into the edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETLIMITTEXT
member.summary: Retrieves the current text limit for an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_POSFROMCHAR
member.summary: Retrieves the client area coordinates of a specified character in an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_CHARFROMPOS
member.summary: Retrieves information about the character closest to a specified point in the client area of an edit control. You can send this message to either an edit control or a rich edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_SETIMESTATUS
member.summary: Sets the status flags that determine how an edit control interacts with the IME.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.EM_GETIMESTATUS
member.summary: Retrieves a set of status flags that indicate how the edit control interacts with the Input Method Editor (IME).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Windows that can accept dragged objects must be created with this style so that Windows can determine that the window will accept objects and can change the drag/drop cursor as the user drags an object over the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Windows XP: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: When this style is enabled, Windows uses a dialog border on a window that has a caption. When used, the WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME style overrides the WS_BORDER and WS_THICKFRAME styles, producing a window with a dialog frame. This extended style is normally used on dialog boxes, but it can be used for any window to get a dialog frame.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Creates a layered window. Note that this cannot be used for child windows. Also, this cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Arabic and Hebrew versions of Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Creates a window whose horizontal origin is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A window created with this style does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: This style is used for child windows. When this style is enabled, Windows does not send WM_NOTIFY messages to the child window's parent. By default, Windows sends WM_NOTIFY messages to a child window's parent when a child window is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE, WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: This style applies only to top-level windows; it is ignored for child windows. When this style is enabled, Windows places the window above any windows that do not have the WS_EX_TOPMOST style. Beginning with Windows version 3.1, there are two classes of top-level windows: topmost top-level windows and top-level windows. Topmost top-level windows always appear above top-level windows in the Z order. Top-level windows can be made topmost top-level windows by calling the SetWindowPos function with the handle to the window and â€“1 for the hwndInsertAfter parameter. Topmost top-level windows can become regular top-level windows by calling SetWindowPos with the window handle and 1 for the hwndInsertAfter parameter.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: The WS_EX_TRANSPARENT style makes a window transparent; that is, the window can be seen through, and anything under the window is still visible. Transparent windows are not transparent to mouse or keyboard events. A transparent window receives paint messages when anything under it changes. Transparent windows are useful for drawing drag handles on top of other windows or for implementing "hot-spot" areas without having to hit test because the transparent window receives click messages.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_WINDOW
member.summary: Returns a device context corresponding to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_CACHE
member.summary: Returns a device context from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_NORESETATTRS
member.summary: Does not reset the attributes of this device context to the default attributes when this device context is released.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_PARENTCLIP
member.summary: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The device context origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_VALIDATE
member.summary: When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the device context to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_EXCLUDERGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned device context.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_INTERSECTRGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned device context.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE
member.summary: Returns a region that excludes the window's update region.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE
member.summary: Returns a region that includes the window's update region.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE
member.summary: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_HORZ
member.summary: Horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_VERT
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_CTL
member.summary: Scroll bar control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_BOTH
member.summary: Horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_LINEUP
member.summary: The user clicks the top scroll arrow. Decrements the scroll box position; scrolls toward the top of the data by one unit.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_LINELEFT
member.summary: The user clicks the left scroll arrow. Decrements the scroll box position; scrolls toward the left end of the data by one unit.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_LINEDOWN
member.summary: The user clicks the bottom scroll arrow. Increments the scroll box position; scrolls toward the bottom of the data by one unit.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_LINERIGHT
member.summary: The user clicks the right scroll arrow. Increments the scroll box position; scrolls toward the right end of the data by one unit.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_PAGEUP
member.summary: The user clicks the scroll bar shaft above the scroll box. Decrements the scroll box position by the number of data units in the window; scrolls toward the top of the data by the same number of units.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_PAGELEFT
member.summary: The user clicks the scroll bar shaft to the left of the scroll box. Decrements the scroll box position by the number of data units in the window; scrolls toward the left end of the data by the same number of units.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_PAGEDOWN
member.summary: The user clicks the scroll bar shaft below the scroll box. Increments the scroll box position by the number of data units in the window; scrolls toward the bottom of the data by the same number of units.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_PAGERIGHT
member.summary: The user clicks the scroll bar shaft to the right of the scroll box. Increments the scroll box position by the number of data units in the window; scrolls toward the right end of the data by the same number of units.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_THUMBPOSITION
member.summary: The user releases the scroll box after dragging it. Sets the scroll box to the position specified in the message; scrolls the data by the same number of units the scroll box has moved.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_THUMBTRACK
member.summary: The user drags the scroll box. Sets the scroll box to the position specified in the message and scrolls the data by the same number of units the scroll box has moved for applications that draw data quickly. Applications that cannot draw data quickly must wait for the SB_THUMBPOSITION request code before moving the scroll box and scrolling the data.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_TOP
member.summary: Scrolls to the upper left.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_LEFT
member.summary: Scroll to far left.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_BOTTOM
member.summary: Scrolls to the lower right.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_RIGHT
member.summary: Scroll to far right.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SB_ENDSCROLL
member.summary: The user releases the mouse after holding it on an arrow or in the scroll bar shaft. No response is needed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.HWND_BOTTOM
member.summary: Places the window at the bottom of the Z order. If the hWnd parameter identifies a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status and is placed at the bottom of all other windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.HWND_TOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is hung. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_WNDPROC
member.summary: Sets a new address for the window procedure. Windows NT/2000/XP: You cannot change this attribute if the window does not belong to the same process as the calling thread.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_HINSTANCE
member.summary: Sets a new application instance handle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_HWNDPARENT
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the parent window, if any.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_STYLE
member.summary: Sets a new window style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_EXSTYLE
member.summary: Sets a new extended window style. For more information, see CreateWindowEx.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_USERDATA
member.summary: Sets the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWL_ID
member.summary: Sets a new identifier of the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWLP_WNDPROC
member.summary: Retrieves the pointer to the window procedure, or a handle representing the pointer to the window procedure. You must use the CallWindowProc function to call the window procedure.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWLP_HINSTANCE
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the application instance.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWLP_HWNDPARENT
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the parent window, if there is one.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWLP_USERDATA
member.summary: Retrieves the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.GWLP_ID
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NULL
member.summary: The WM_NULL message performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_THEMECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_THEMECHANGED message is broadcast to every window following a theme change event. Examples of theme change events are the activation of a theme, the deactivation of a theme, or a transition from one theme to another.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CREATE
member.summary: The WM_CREATE message is sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function. (The message is sent before the function returns.) The window procedure of the new window receives this message after the window is created, but before the window becomes visible.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DESTROY
member.summary: The WM_DESTROY message is sent when a window is being destroyed. It is sent to the window procedure of the window being destroyed after the window is removed from the screen.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SIZE
member.summary: The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATE message is sent to both the window being activated and the window being deactivated. If the windows use the same input queue, the message is sent synchronously, first to the window procedure of the top-level window being deactivated, then to the window procedure of the top-level window being activated. If the windows use different input queues, the message is sent asynchronously, so the window is activated immediately.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_SETFOCUS message is sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_KILLFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_KILLFOCUS message is sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ENABLE
member.summary: The WM_ENABLE message is sent when an application changes the enabled state of a window. It is sent to the window whose enabled state is changing. This message is sent before the EnableWindow function returns, but after the enabled state (WS_DISABLED style bit) of the window has changed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETTEXT message to set the text of a window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXT message to copy the text that corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETTEXTLENGTH
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXTLENGTH message to determine the length, in characters, of the text associated with a window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window. The message is sent when the UpdateWindow or RedrawWindow function is called, or by the DispatchMessage function when the application obtains a WM_PAINT message by using the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CLOSE
member.summary: The WM_CLOSE message is sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls the ExitWindows function. If any application returns zero, the session is not ended. The system stops sending WM_QUERYENDSESSION messages as soon as one application returns zero. After processing this message, the system sends the WM_ENDSESSION message with the wParam parameter set to the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUIT
member.summary: The WM_QUIT message indicates a request to terminate an application and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function. It causes the GetMessage function to return zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUERYOPEN
member.summary: The WM_QUERYOPEN message is sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ERASEBKGND message is sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an invalidated portion of a window for painting.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_ENDSESSION message is sent to an application after the system processes the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message. The WM_ENDSESSION message informs the application whether the session is ending.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: The WM_SHOWWINDOW message is sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_WININICHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI. The WM_WININICHANGE message is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of the system. Applications should use the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: The system sends the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed. Applications should send WM_SETTINGCHANGE to all top-level windows when they make changes to system parameters. (This message cannot be sent directly to a window.) To send the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message to all top-level windows, use the SendMessageTimeout function with the hwnd parameter set to HWND_BROADCAST.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DEVMODECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVMODECHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows whenever the user changes device-mode settings.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ACTIVATEAPP
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATEAPP message is sent when a window belonging to a different application than the active window is about to be activated. The message is sent to the application whose window is being activated and to the application whose window is being deactivated.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_FONTCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_FONTCHANGE message to all top-level windows in the system after changing the pool of font resources.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_TIMECHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_TIMECHANGE message whenever it updates the system time.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CANCELMODE
member.summary: The WM_CANCELMODE message is sent to cancel certain modes, such as mouse capture. For example, the system sends this message to the active window when a dialog box or message box is displayed. Certain functions also send this message explicitly to the specified window regardless of whether it is the active window. For example, the EnableWindow function sends this message when disabling the specified window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETCURSOR
member.summary: The WM_SETCURSOR message is sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message is sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button. The parent window receives this message only if the child window passes it to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CHILDACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_CHILDACTIVATE message is sent to a child window when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUEUESYNC
member.summary: The WM_QUEUESYNC message is sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK Hook procedure.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PAINTICON
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_PAINTICON message is sent to a minimized window when the icon is to be painted. This message is not sent by newer versions of Microsoft Windows, except in unusual circumstances explained in the Remarks. Windows 95/98/Me, Windows NT 4.0 and later: This message is sent only to 16-bit windows (note that this is with a lowercase "W"), and only for compatibility reasons. Under such conditions, the value of wParam is TRUE (the value carries no significance). On Microsoft Windows NT 3.51 and earlier, or on newer versions of Windows when the unusual circumstances above are met, the window receives this message only if a class icon is defined for the window; otherwise, WM_PAINT is sent instead. Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The DefWindowProc function draws the class icon. On newer versions of Windows, the DefWindowProc function ignores the message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ICONERASEBKGND
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_ICONERASEBKGND message is sent to a minimized window when the background of the icon must be filled before painting the icon. A window receives this message only if a class icon is defined for the window; otherwise, WM_ERASEBKGND is sent. This message is not sent by newer versions of Windows. Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The DefWindowProc function fills the icon background with the class background brush of the parent window. On newer versions of Windows, the DefWindowProc function ignores the message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: The WM_NEXTDLGCTL message is sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DRAWITEM
member.summary: The WM_DRAWITEM message is sent to the parent window of an owner-drawn button, combo box, list box, or menu when a visual aspect of the button, combo box, list box, or menu has changed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MEASUREITEM
member.summary: The WM_MEASUREITEM message is sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DELETEITEM
member.summary: The WM_DELETEITEM message is sent to the owner of a list box or combo box when the list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed by the LB_DELETESTRING, LB_RESETCONTENT, CB_DELETESTRING, or CB_RESETCONTENT message. The system sends a WM_DELETEITEM message for each deleted item. The system sends the WM_DELETEITEM message for any deleted list box or combo box item with nonzero item data.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: The WM_VKEYTOITEM message is sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CHARTOITEM
member.summary: The WM_CHARTOITEM message is sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_CHAR message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETFONT message to specify the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETFONT message to a control to retrieve the font with which the control is currently drawing its text.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETHOTKEY message to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETHOTKEY message to determine the hot key associated with a window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: The WM_QUERYDRAGICON message is sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class. An application can return a handle to an icon or cursor. The system displays this cursor or icon while the user drags the icon.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COMPAREITEM
member.summary: The system sends the WM_COMPAREITEM message to determine the relative position of a new item in the sorted list of an owner-drawn combo box or list box. Whenever the application adds a new item, the system sends this message to the owner of a combo box or list box created with the CBS_SORT or LBS_SORT style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETOBJECT
member.summary: Active Accessibility sends the WM_GETOBJECT message to obtain information about an accessible object contained in a server application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COMPACTING
member.summary: The WM_COMPACTING message is sent to all top-level windows when the system detects more than 12.5 percent of system time over a 30- to 60-second interval is being spent compacting memory. This indicates that system memory is low.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COMMNOTIFY
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_POWER
member.summary: The WM_POWER message is broadcast when the system, typically a battery-powered personal computer, is about to enter suspended mode.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CANCELJOURNAL
member.summary: The WM_CANCELJOURNAL message is posted to an application when a user cancels the application's journaling activities. The message is posted with a NULL window handle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_NOTIFY message is sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message is posted to the window with the focus when the user chooses a new input language, either with the hotkey (specified in the Keyboard control panel application) or from the indicator on the system taskbar. An application can accept the change by passing the message to the DefWindowProc function or reject the change (and prevent it from taking place) by returning immediately.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE message is sent to the topmost affected window after an application's input language has been changed. You should make any application-specific settings and pass the message to the DefWindowProc function, which passes the message to all first-level child windows. These child windows can pass the message to DefWindowProc to have it pass the message to their child windows, and so on.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Microsoft Windows Help. The message informs the application when the user clicks an authorable button. An application initiates a training card by specifying the HELP_TCARD command in a call to the WinHelp function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the user pressed the F1 key. If a menu is active when F1 is pressed, WM_HELP is sent to the window associated with the menu; otherwise, WM_HELP is sent to the window that has the keyboard focus. If no window has the keyboard focus, WM_HELP is sent to the currently active window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_USERCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_USERCHANGED message is sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off. When the user logs on or off, the system updates the user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Used to determine if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message. WM_NOTIFYFORMAT messages are sent from a common control to its parent window and from the parent window to the common control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CONTEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_CONTEXTMENU message notifies a window that the user clicked the right mouse button (right-clicked) in the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_STYLECHANGING
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGING message is sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_STYLECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGED message is sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DISPLAYCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent to all windows when the display resolution has changed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETICON
member.summary: The WM_GETICON message is sent to a window to retrieve a handle to the large or small icon associated with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SETICON
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETICON message to associate a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCCREATE
member.summary: The WM_NCCREATE message is sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCDESTROY
member.summary: The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message. WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: The WM_NCCALCSIZE message is sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_GETDLGCODE
member.summary: The WM_GETDLGCODE message is sent to the window procedure associated with a control. By default, the system handles all keyboard input to the control; the system interprets certain types of keyboard input as dialog box navigation keys. To override this default behavior, the control can respond to the WM_GETDLGCODE message to indicate the types of input it wants to process itself.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYNCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_SYNCPAINT message is used to synchronize painting while avoiding linking independent GUI threads.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the nonclient area of the window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCXBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_DEADCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_DEADCHAR specifies a character code generated by a dead key. A dead key is a key that generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with another character to form a composite character. For example, the umlaut-O character (O) is generated by typing the dead key for the umlaut character, and then typing the O key.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key â€” that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSDEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSDEADCHAR message is sent to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_SYSDEADCHAR specifies the character code of a system dead key â€” that is, a dead key that is pressed while holding down the ALT key.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_KEYLAST
member.summary: This message filters for keyboard messages.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_STARTCOMPOSITION message is sent immediately before the IME generates the composition string as a result of a keystroke. The message is a notification to an IME window to open its composition window. An application should process this message if it displays composition characters itself.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_ENDCOMPOSITION message is sent to an application when the IME ends composition. An application should process this message if it displays composition characters itself.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_COMPOSITION
member.summary: The WM_IME_COMPOSITION message is sent to an application when the IME changes composition status as a result of a keystroke. An application should process this message if it displays composition characters itself. Otherwise, it should send the message to the IME window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_KEYLAST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_INITDIALOG
member.summary: The WM_INITDIALOG message is sent to the dialog box procedure immediately before a dialog box is displayed. Dialog box procedures typically use this message to initialize controls and carry out any other initialization tasks that affect the appearance of the dialog box.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COMMAND
member.summary: The WM_COMMAND message is sent when the user selects a command item from a menu, when a control sends a notification message to its parent window, or when an accelerator keystroke is translated.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_TIMER
member.summary: The WM_TIMER message is posted to the installing thread's message queue when a timer expires. The message is posted by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard horizontal scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a horizontal scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_VSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard vertical scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a vertical scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_INITMENU
member.summary: The WM_INITMENU message is sent when a menu is about to become active. It occurs when the user clicks an item on the menu bar or presses a menu key. This allows the application to modify the menu before it is displayed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_INITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: The WM_INITMENUPOPUP message is sent when a drop-down menu or submenu is about to become active. This allows an application to modify the menu before it is displayed, without changing the entire menu.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENUSELECT
member.summary: The WM_MENUSELECT message is sent to a menu's owner window when the user selects a menu item.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENUCHAR
member.summary: The WM_MENUCHAR message is sent when a menu is active and the user presses a key that does not correspond to any mnemonic or accelerator key. This message is sent to the window that owns the menu.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ENTERIDLE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERIDLE message is sent to the owner window of a modal dialog box or menu that is entering an idle state. A modal dialog box or menu enters an idle state when no messages are waiting in its queue after it has processed one or more previous messages.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENURBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MENURBUTTONUP message is sent when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is on a menu item.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENUDRAG
member.summary: The WM_MENUDRAG message is sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the user drags a menu item.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENUGETOBJECT
