member.summary: The WM_MENUGETOBJECT message is sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the mouse cursor enters a menu item or moves from the center of the item to the top or bottom of the item.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: The WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP message is sent when a drop-down menu or submenu has been destroyed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MENUCOMMAND
member.summary: The WM_MENUCOMMAND message is sent when the user makes a selection from a menu.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORMSGBOX
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLOREDIT
member.summary: An edit control that is not read-only or disabled sends the WM_CTLCOLOREDIT message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORLISTBOX
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORLISTBOX message is sent to the parent window of a list box before the system draws the list box. By responding to this message, the parent window can set the text and background colors of the list box by using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORBTN
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORBTN message is sent to the parent window of a button before drawing the button. The parent window can change the button's text and background colors. However, only owner-drawn buttons respond to the parent window processing this message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORDLG
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORDLG message is sent to a dialog box before the system draws the dialog box. By responding to this message, the dialog box can set its text and background colors using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR message is sent to the parent window of a scroll bar control when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the display context handle to set the background color of the scroll bar control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC
member.summary: A static control, or an edit control that is read-only or disabled, sends the WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the static control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chainuntil it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_XBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_XBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_PARENTNOTIFY message is sent to the parent of a child window when the child window is created or destroyed, or when the user clicks a mouse button while the cursor is over the child window. When the child window is being created, the system sends WM_PARENTNOTIFY just before the CreateWindow or CreateWindowEx function that creates the window returns. When the child window is being destroyed, the system sends the message before any processing to destroy the window takes place.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ENTERMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_ENTERMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been entered.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_EXITMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_EXITMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been exited.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_NEXTMENU message is sent to an application when the right or left arrow key is used to switch between the menu bar and the system menu.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SIZING
member.summary: The WM_SIZING message is sent to a window that the user is resizing. By processing this message, an application can monitor the size and position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its size or position.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CAPTURECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_CAPTURECHANGED message is sent to the window that is losing the mouse capture.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOVING
member.summary: The WM_MOVING message is sent to a window that the user is moving. By processing this message, an application can monitor the position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its position.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DEVICECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVICECHANGE device message notifies an application of a change to the hardware configuration of a device or the computer.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDICREATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICREATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to create an MDI child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIDESTROY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIDESTROY message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to close an MDI child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIACTIVATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIACTIVATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to instruct the client window to activate a different MDI child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIRESTORE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIRESTORE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to restore an MDI child window from maximized or minimized size.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDINEXT
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDINEXT message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to activate the next or previous child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIMAXIMIZE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIMAXIMIZE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to maximize an MDI child window. The system resizes the child window to make its client area fill the client window. The system places the child window's window menu icon in the rightmost position of the frame window's menu bar, and places the child window's restore icon in the leftmost position. The system also appends the title bar text of the child window to that of the frame window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDITILE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDITILE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all of its MDI child windows in a tile format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDICASCADE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICASCADE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all its child windows in a cascade format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIICONARRANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIICONARRANGE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all minimized MDI child windows. It does not affect child windows that are not minimized.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIGETACTIVE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIGETACTIVE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to retrieve the handle to the active MDI child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDISETMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDISETMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to replace the entire menu of an MDI frame window, to replace the window menu of the frame window, or both.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window after it enters the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_EXITSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_EXITSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window, after it has exited the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DROPFILES
member.summary: Sent when the user drops a file on the window of an application that has registered itself as a recipient of dropped files.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MDIREFRESHMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIREFRESHMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to refresh the window menu of the MDI frame window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_SETCONTEXT
member.summary: The WM_IME_SETCONTEXT message is sent to an application when a window of the application is activated. If the application has created an IME window, it should call the ImmIsUIMessage function. Otherwise, it should pass this message to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_NOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_IME_NOTIFY message is sent to an application to notify it of changes to the IME window. An application processes this message if it is responsible for managing the IME window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_CONTROL
member.summary: The WM_IME_CONTROL message directs the IME window to carry out the requested command. An application uses this message to control the IME window created by the application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_COMPOSITIONFULL
member.summary: The WM_IME_COMPOSITIONFULL message is sent to an application when the IME window finds no space to extend the area for the composition window. The application should use the IMC_SETCOMPOSITIONWINDOW command to specify how the window should be displayed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_SELECT
member.summary: The WM_IME_SELECT message is sent to an application when the system is about to change the current IME. An application that has created an IME window should pass this message to that window so that it can retrieve the keyboard layout handle for the newly selected IME.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_CHAR
member.summary: The WM_IME_CHAR message is sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result. Unlike the WM_CHAR message for a non-Unicode window, this message can include double-byte as well as single-byte character values. For a Unicode window, this message is the same as WM_CHAR.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_REQUEST
member.summary: The WM_IME_REQUEST message provides a group of commands to request information from an application.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_IME_KEYDOWN message is sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key press. An application can process this message or pass it to the DefWindowProc function to generate a matching WM_KEYDOWN message. This message is usually generated by the IME to keep message order.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_IME_KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_IME_KEYUP message is sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key release. An application can process this message or pass it to the DefWindowProc function to generate a matching WM_KEYUP message. This message is usually generated by the IME to keep message order.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOUSEHOVER
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEHOVER message is posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_MOUSELEAVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSELEAVE message is posted to a window when the cursor leaves the client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CUT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CUT message to an edit control or combo box to delete (cut) the current selection, if any, in the edit control and copy the deleted text to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_COPY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPY message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current selection to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PASTE
member.summary: An application sends a WM_PASTE message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current content of the clipboard to the edit control at the current caret position. Data is inserted only if the clipboard contains data in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CLEAR
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CLEAR message to an edit control or combo box to delete (clear) the current selection, if any, from the edit control.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_UNDO
member.summary: An application sends a WM_UNDO message to an edit control to undo the last operation. When this message is sent to an edit control, the previously deleted text is restored or the previously added text is deleted.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_RENDERFORMAT
member.summary: The WM_RENDERFORMAT message is sent to the clipboard owner if it has delayed rendering a specific clipboard format and if an application has requested data in that format. The clipboard owner must render data in the specified format and place it on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_RENDERALLFORMATS
member.summary: The WM_RENDERALLFORMATS message is sent to the clipboard owner before it is destroyed, if the clipboard owner has delayed rendering one or more clipboard formats. For the content of the clipboard to remain available to other applications, the clipboard owner must render data in all the formats it is capable of generating, and place the data on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner when a call to the EmptyClipboard function empties the clipboard.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when the content of the clipboard changes. This enables a clipboard viewer window to display the new content of the clipboard.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area needs repainting.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's vertical scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_SIZECLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_SIZECLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME
member.summary: The WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window to request the name of a CF_OWNERDISPLAY clipboard format.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_CHANGECBCHAIN
member.summary: The WM_CHANGECBCHAIN message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when a window is being removed from the chain.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window. This occurs when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's horizontal scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: The WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_PALETTECHANGED message is sent to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus has realized its logical palette, thereby changing the system palette. This message enables a window that uses a color palette but does not have the keyboard focus to realize its logical palette and update its client area.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HOTKEY
member.summary: The WM_HOTKEY message is posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function. The message is placed at the top of the message queue associated with the thread that registered the hot key.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HANDHELDFIRST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_HANDHELDLAST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_AFXFIRST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_AFXLAST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PENWINFIRST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_PENWINLAST
member.summary: No documentation available.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_APP
member.summary: The WM_APP constant is used by applications to help define private messages, usually of the form WM_APP+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_USER
member.summary: The WM_USER constant is used by applications to help define private messages for use by private window classes, usually of the form WM_USER+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMOUSELEAVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSELEAVE message is posted to a window when the cursor leaves the nonclient area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent. Not used, must be zero. Not used, must be zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WM_NCMOUSEHOVER
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEHOVER message is posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the nonclient area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent. Specifies the hit-test value returned by the DefWindowProc function as a result of processing the WM_NCHITTEST message. For a list of hit-test values, see WM_NCHITTEST. Specifies a POINTS structure that contains the x- and y-coordinates of the cursor. The coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use EnableWindow.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_ICONIC
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window with WS_BORDER, WS_POPUP, and WS_SYSMENU styles. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_SIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_TILED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the WS_OVERLAPPED, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, and WS_MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.MA_ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates the window, and does not discard the mouse message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.MA_ACTIVATEANDEAT
member.summary: Activates the window, and discards the mouse message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.MA_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window, and does not discard the mouse message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.MA_NOACTIVATEANDEAT
member.summary: Does not activate the window, but discards the mouse message.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_ALIGNTOP
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the top of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the upper-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNTOP and WVR_ALIGNLEFT values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the left side of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the lower-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNLEFT and WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the bottom of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the top-left corner, return the WVR_ALIGNTOP and WVR_ALIGNLEFT values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_ALIGNRIGHT
member.summary: Specifies that the client area of the window is to be preserved and aligned with the right side of the new position of the window. For example, to align the client area to the lower-right corner, return the WVR_ALIGNRIGHT and WVR_ALIGNBOTTOM values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_HREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size horizontally. This value is similar to CS_HREDRAW class style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_VREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size vertically. This value is similar to CS_VREDRAW class style.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_REDRAW
member.summary: This value causes the entire window to be redrawn. It is a combination of WVR_HREDRAW and WVR_VREDRAW values.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.WVR_VALIDRECTS
member.summary: This value indicates that, upon return from WM_NCCALCSIZE, the rectangles specified by the rgrc[1] and rgrc[2] members of the NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS structure contain valid destination and source area rectangles, respectively. The system combines these rectangles to calculate the area of the window to be preserved. The system copies any part of the window image that is within the source rectangle and clips the image to the destination rectangle. Both rectangles are in parent-relative or screen-relative coordinates. This return value allows an application to implement more elaborate client-area preservation strategies, such as centering or preserving a subset of the client area.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_CHECKVISIBLE
member.summary: Draws the window only if it is visible.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_NONCLIENT
member.summary: Draws the nonclient area of the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_CLIENT
member.summary: Draws the client area of the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_ERASEBKGND
member.summary: Erases the background before drawing the window.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_CHILDREN
member.summary: Draws all visible children windows.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.WinUser.PRF_OWNED
member.summary: Draws all owned windows.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.NuGenInvalidHWndException
member.summary: Thrown if the specified handle does not represent a window.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.NuGenInvalidHWndException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Causes a window to use a different set of visual style information than its class normally uses.
member.param: Handle to the window whose visual style information is to be changed.
String that contains the application name to use in place of the calling application's name. If this parameter is , the calling application's name is used.

String that contains a semicolon-separated list of class identifier (CLSID) names to use in place of the actual list passed by the window's class. If this parameter is , the identifier (ID) list from the calling class is used.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM
member.summary: Specifies or receives attributes of a tree-view item. This structure is identical to the TV_ITEM structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions. New applications should use this structure.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.mask
member.summary: Array of flags that indicate which of the other structure members contain valid data. When this structure is used with the TVM_GETITEM message, the mask member indicates the item attributes to retrieve.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.hItem
member.summary: Item to which this structure refers.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.state
member.summary: Set of bit flags and image list indexes that indicate the item's state. When setting the state of an item, the stateMask member indicates the bits of this member that are valid. When retrieving the state of an item, this member returns the current state for the bits indicated in the stateMask member.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.stateMask
member.summary: Bits of the state member that are valid. If you are retrieving an item's state, set the bits of the stateMask member to indicate the bits to be returned in the state member. If you are setting an item's state, set the bits of the stateMask member to indicate the bits of the state member that you want to set. To set or retrieve an item's overlay image index, set the TVIS_OVERLAYMASK bits. To set or retrieve an item's state image index, set the TVIS_STATEIMAGEMASK bits.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.pszText
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the item text if the structure specifies item attributes. If this member is the LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the name. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent window a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification message when it needs the item text for displaying, sorting, or editing and a TVN_SETDISPINFO notification message when the item text changes. If the structure is receiving item attributes, this member is the address of the buffer that receives the item text. Note that although the tree-view control allows any length string to be stored as item text, only the first 260 characters are displayed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.cchTextMax
member.summary: Size of the buffer pointed to by the pszText member, in characters. If this structure is being used to set item attributes, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.iImage
member.summary: Index in the tree-view control's image list of the icon image to use when the item is in the nonselected state. If this member is the I_IMAGECALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the index. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification message to retrieve the index when it needs to display the image.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.iSelectedImage
member.summary: Index in the tree-view control's image list of the icon image to use when the item is in the selected state. If this member is the I_IMAGECALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the index. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification message to retrieve the index when it needs to display the image.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.cChildren
member.summary: Flag that indicates whether the item has associated child items.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TVITEM.lParam
member.summary: A value to associate with the item.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.NetApi32
member.summary: Imports NetApi32.dll functions.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.NetApi32.NetApiBufferFree(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees the memory that the NetApiBufferAllocate function allocates. Call NetApiBufferFree to free the memory that other network management functions return.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer returned previously by another network management function.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.NetApi32.NetServerEnum(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Lists all servers of the specified type that are visible in a domain.
member.example: An application can call NetServerEnum to list all domain controllers only or all SQL servers only.
member.param: Reserved; must be System.IntPtr.Zero.

Specifies the information level of the data. This parameter can be one of the following values.
100 Return server names and platform information. The buffer parameter points to an array of SERVER_INFO_100 structures.
101 Return server names, types, and associated software. The buffer parameter points to an array of SERVER_INFO_101 structures.

Pointer to the buffer that receives the data. The format of this data depends on the value of the level parameter. This buffer is allocated by the system and must be freed using the NetApiBufferFree function. Note that you must free the buffer even if the function fails with ERROR_MORE_DATA.

Specifies the preferred maximum length of returned data, in bytes. If you specify MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH, the function allocates the amount of memory required for the data. If you specify another value in this parameter, it can restrict the number of bytes that the function returns. If the buffer size is insufficient to hold all entries, the function returns ERROR_MORE_DATA.
Pointer to a value that receives the count of elements actually enumerated.
Pointer to a value that receives the total number of visible servers and workstations on the network. Note that applications should consider this value only as a hint.
Specifies a value that filters the server entries to return from the enumeration.

Pointer to a constant string that specifies the name of the domain for which a list of servers is to be returned. The domain name must be a NetBIOS domain name (for example, microsoft). NetServerEnum does not support DNS-style names (for example, microsoft.com). If this parameter is null, the primary domain is implied.
Reserved; must be set to System.IntPtr.Zero.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value can be one of the following error codes.
ERROR_NO_BROWSER_SERVERS_FOUND
No browser servers found.
ERROR_MORE_DATA
More entries are available. Specify a large enough buffer to receive all entries.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.NetApi32.NetServerGetInfo(System.String,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves current configuration information for the specified server.
member.param: Pointer to a string that specifies the name of the remote server on which the function is to execute. If this parameter is null, the local computer is used. In Windows NT this string must begin with \\.

Specifies the information level of the data. This parameter can be one of the following values.
100
Return the server name and platform information. The buffer parameter points to a SERVER_INFO_100 structure.
101
Return the server name, type, and associated software. The buffer parameter points to a SERVER_INFO_101 structure.
102
Return the server name, type, associated software, and other attributes. The buffer parameter points to a SERVER_INFO_102 structure.

Pointer to the buffer that receives the data. The format of this data depends on the value of the level parameter. This buffer is allocated by the system and must be freed using the NetApiBufferFree function.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value can be one of the following error codes.
ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED
The user does not have access to the requested information.
ERROR_INVALID_LEVEL
The value specified for the level parameter is invalid.
ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER
The specified parameter is invalid.
ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY
Insufficient memory is available.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.ChildWindowFromPointEx(System.IntPtr,Genetibase.WinApi.POINT,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to the specified parent window contains the specified point. The function can ignore invisible, disabled, and transparent child windows.
member.param: Identifies the parent window.
Specifies a POINT structure that defines the client coordinates of the point to be checked.
Specifies which child windows to skip.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the first child window that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by uFlags. If the point is within the parent window but not within any child window that meets the criteria, the return value is the handle to the parent window. If the point lies outside the parent window or if the function fails, the return value is IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle of a display device context (DC) for the client area of the specified window. The display device context can be used in subsequent GDI functions to draw in the client area of the window.
member.param: Identifies the window whose device context is to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value identifies the device context for the given window's client area; otherwise, the return value is null.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetDCEx(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the handle of a display device (DC) context for the specified window. The display device context can be used in subsequent GDI functions to draw in the client area.
member.param: Identifies the window where drawing will occur.
Specifies a clipping region that may be combined with the visible region of the client window.
Specifies how the device context is created.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle of the device context for the given window; otherwise, the return value is IntPtr.Zero. An invalid value for the hWnd parameter will cause the function to fail.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetScrollPos(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the current position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar. The current position is a relative value that depends on the current scrolling range. For example, if the scrolling range is 0 through 100 and the scroll box is in the middle of the bar, the current position is 50.
member.param: Handle to a scroll bar control or a window with a standard scroll bar, depending on the value of the nBar parameter.
Specifies the scroll bar to be examined.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the current position of the scroll box; otherwise, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetWindowDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves the device context (DC) for the entire window, including title bar, menus, and scroll bars. A window device context permits painting anywhere in a window, because the origin of the device context is the upper-left corner of the window instead of the client area.
member.param: Identifies the window with a device context that is to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle of a device context for the specified window; otherwise, the return value is IntPtr.Zero, indicating an error or an invalid hWnd parameter.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the specified window. The function also retrieves the 32-bit (long) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.param: Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.

Specifies the zero-based offset to the value to be retrieved. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus four; for example, if you specified 12 or more bytes of extra memory, a value of 8 would be an index to the third 32-bit integer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested 32-bit value. Otherwise, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If SetWindowLong has not been called previously, GetWindowLong returns zero for values in the extra window or class memory.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetWindowLongEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calls or depending on the .
member.param: Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
Specifies the zero-based offset to the value to be retrieved. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of an integer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested value. Otherwise, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If SetWindowLong has not been called previously, GetWindowLong returns zero for values in the extra window or class memory.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.GetWindowLongPtr(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

(Pointers and handles are 32 bits on 32-bit Windows and 64 bits on 64-bit Windows.) To write code that is compatible with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows, use GetWindowLongPtr.
Specifies the zero-based offset to the value to be retrieved. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of an integer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested value. Otherwise, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If SetWindowLong has not been called previously, GetWindowLong returns zero for values in the extra window or class memory.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.InvalidateRect(System.IntPtr,Genetibase.WinApi.RECT@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a rectangle to the specified window's update region. The update region represents the portion of the window's client area that must be redrawn.
member.param: Identifies the window whose update region has changed. If this parameter is null, Windows invalidates and redraws all windows, and sends the WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_NCPAINT messages to the window procedure before the function returns.
Points to a RECT structure that contains the client coordinates of the rectangle to be added to the update region. If this parameter is null, the entire client area is added to the update region.

Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.InvalidateRect(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)

Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.MoveWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the position and dimensions of the specified window. For a top-level window, the position and dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: Handle to the window.
Specifies the new position of the left side of the window.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window.
Specifies the new width of the window.
Specifies the new height of the window.

Specifies whether the window is to be repainted. If this parameter is true, the window receives a message; otherwise, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of moving a child window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.ReleaseCapture
member.summary: Releases the mouse capture from a window in the current thread and restores normal mouse input processing. A window that has captured the mouse receives all mouse input, regardless of the position of the cursor, except when a mouse button is clicked while the cursor hot spot is in the window of another thread.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.ReleaseDC(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Releases a device context (DC), freeing it for use by other applications. The effect of the ReleaseDC function depends on the type of DC. It frees only common and window DCs. It has no effect on class or private DCs.
member.param: Handle to the window whose DC is to be released.
Handle to the DC to be released.
member.returns: The return value indicates whether the DC was released. If the DC was released, the return value is 1. If the DC was not released, the return value is zero.

member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the previous parent window; otherwise, null. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.SetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets the 32-bit (long) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.remarks: This function has been superseded by the SetWindowLongPtr function. To write code that is compatible with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Microsoft Windows, use the SetWindowLongPtr function.
member.param: Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs. Windows 95/98/Me: The SetWindowLong function may fail if the window specified by the hWnd parameter does not belong to the same process as the calling thread.
Specifies the zero-based offset to the value to be set. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of an integer.
Specifies the replacement value.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified 32-bit integer; otherwise, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. Child, pop-up, and top-level windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: Handle to the window.
Handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order.
Specifies the new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new width of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the new height of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the window sizing and positioning flags.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, the return value is false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's show state.
member.param: Handle to the window.

Specifies how the window is to be shown. This parameter is ignored the first time an application calls ShowWindow, if the program that launched the application provides a STARTUPINFO structure. Otherwise, the first time ShowWindow is called, the value should be the value obtained by the WinMain function in its nCmdShow parameter.
member.returns: If the window was previously visible, the return value is true. If the window was previously hidden, the return value is false.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.UpdateLayeredWindow(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,Genetibase.WinApi.POINT@,Genetibase.WinApi.SIZE@,System.IntPtr,Genetibase.WinApi.POINT@,System.Int32,Genetibase.WinApi.BLENDFUNCTION@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the position, size, shape, content, and translucency of a layered window.
member.param: Handle to a layered window. A layered window is created by specifying WS_EX_LAYERED when creating the window with the CreateWindowEx function.

Handle to a device context (DC) for the screen. This handle is obtained by specifying IntPtr.Zero when calling the function. It is used for palette color matching when the window contents are updated. If hdcDst is IntPtr.Zero, the default palette will be used. If hdcSrc is IntPtr.Zero, hdcDst must be IntPtr.Zero.
Pointer to a POINT structure that specifies the new screen position of the layered window. If the current position is not changing, pptDst can be null.
Pointer to a SIZE structure that specifies the new size of the layered window. If the size of the window is not changing, psize can be null. If hdcSrc is null, psize must be null.

Handle to a DC for the surface that defines the layered window. This handle can be obtained by calling the CreateCompatibleDC function. If the shape and visual context of the window are not changing, hdcSrc can be null.
Pointer to a POINT structure that specifies the location of the layer in the device context. If hdcSrc is null, pptSrc should be null.
Specifies the color key to be used when composing the layered window.
Pointer to a BLENDFUNCTION structure that specifies the transparency value to be used when composing the layered window.
If hdcSrc is null, dwFlags should be zero.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true; otherwise, the return value is false. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Genetibase.WinApi.User32.WindowFromPoint(Genetibase.WinApi.POINT)
member.summary: Retrieves the handle of the window that contains the specified .
member.param: Specifies the point to be checked.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_DODEFAULT
member.summary: The control will draw itself. It will not send any additional NM_CUSTOMDRAW messages for this paint cycle. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_NEWFONT
member.summary: The application specified a new font for the item; the control will use the new font. For more information about changing fonts, see Changing fonts and colors. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_SKIPDEFAULT
member.summary: The application drew the item manually. The control will not draw the item. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTPAINT
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after painting an item. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW
member.summary: The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification messages before and after drawing items. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_NOTIFYSUBITEMDRAW
member.summary: Your application will receive an NM_CUSTOMDRAW message with dwDrawState set to CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT | CDDS_SUBITEM before each list-view subitem is drawn. You can then specify font and color for each subitem separately or return CDRF_DODEFAULT for default processing. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.CommCtrl.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTERASE
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after erasing an item. This occurs when dwDrawState equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: T:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC
member.summary: Contains basic information about a physical font. All sizes are specified in logical units; that is, they depend on the current mapping mode of the display context.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height (ascent + descent) of characters.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmAscent
member.summary: Specifies the ascent (units above the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmDescent
member.summary: Specifies the descent (units below the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmInternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of leading (space) inside the bounds set by the tmHeight member. Accent marks and other diacritical characters may occur in this area. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmExternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of extra leading (space) that the application adds between rows. Since this area is outside the font, it contains no marks and is not altered by text output calls in either OPAQUE or TRANSPARENT mode. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmAveCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the average width of characters in the font (generally defined as the width of the letter x). This value does not include the overhang required for bold or italic characters.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmMaxCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the widest character in the font.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmOverhang
member.summary: Specifies the extra width per string that may be added to some synthesized fonts. When synthesizing some attributes, such as bold or italic, graphics device interface (GDI) or a device may have to add width to a string on both a per-character and per-string basis. For example, GDI makes a string bold by expanding the spacing of each character and overstriking by an offset value; it italicizes a font by shearing the string. In either case, there is an overhang past the basic string. For bold strings, the overhang is the distance by which the overstrike is offset. For italic strings, the overhang is the amount the top of the font is sheared past the bottom of the font. The tmOverhang member enables the application to determine how much of the character width returned by a GetTextExtentPoint32 function call on a single character is the actual character width and how much is the per-string extra width. The actual width is the extent minus the overhang.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmDigitizedAspectX
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal aspect of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmDigitizedAspectY
member.summary: Specifies the vertical aspect of the device for which the font was designed. The ratio of the tmDigitizedAspectX and tmDigitizedAspectY members is the aspect ratio of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmFirstChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the first character defined in the font.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmLastChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the last character defined in the font.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmDefaultChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character to be substituted for characters not in the font.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmBreakChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character that will be used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmItalic
member.summary: Specifies an italic font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmUnderlined
member.summary: Specifies an underlined font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmStruckOut
member.summary: Specifies a strikeout font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmPitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies information about the pitch, the technology, and the family of a physical font. The four low-order bits of this member specify information about the pitch and the technology of the font. A constant is defined for each of the four bits. TMPF_FIXED_PITCH - If this bit is set the font is a variable pitch font. If this bit is clear the font is a fixed pitch font. Note very carefully that those meanings are the opposite of what the constant name implies. -or- TMPF_VECTOR - If this bit is set the font is a vector font. -or- TMPF_TRUETYPE - If this bit is set the font is a TrueType font. -or- TMPF_DEVICE - If this bit is set the font is a device font. An application should carefully test for qualities encoded in these low-order bits, making no arbitrary assumptions. For example, besides having their own bits set, TrueType and PostScript fonts set the TMPF_VECTOR bit. A monospace bitmap font has all of these low-order bits clear; a proportional bitmap font sets the TMPF_FIXED_PITCH bit. A Postscript printer device font sets the TMPF_DEVICE, TMPF_VECTOR, and TMPF_FIXED_PITCH bits. The four high-order bits of tmPitchAndFamily designate the font's font family. An application can use the value 0xF0 and the bitwise AND operator to mask out the four low-order bits of , thus obtaining a value that can be directly compared with font family names to find an identical match. For information about font families, see the description of the LOGFONT structure.

member.name: F:Genetibase.WinApi.TEXTMETRIC.tmCharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set of the font. The character set can be one of the following values. ANSI_CHARSET -or- BALTIC_CHARSET -or- CHINESEBIG5_CHARSET -or- DEFAULT_CHARSET -or- EASTEUROPE_CHARSET -or- GB2312_CHARSET -or- GREEK_CHARSET -or- HANGUL_CHARSET -or- MAC_CHARSET -or- OEM_CHARSET -or- RUSSIAN_CHARSET -or- SHIFTJIS_CHARSET -or- SYMBOL_CHARSET -or- TURKISH_CHARSET -or- VIETNAMESE_CHARSET -Korean language edition of Windows- JOHAB_CHARSET -Middle East language edition of Windows- ARABIC_CHARSET -or- HEBREW_CHARSET -Thai language edition of Windows- THAI_CHARSET
